title: Build a Custom Hash Map Implementation
description: Create a complete hash map implementation from scratch in Python. Your implementation should handle collisions, support dynamic resizing, and provide efficient operations. This project will deepen your understanding of how hash tables work internally and the trade-offs involved in their design.
requirements: Implement a hash function that distributes keys uniformly
Handle collisions using chaining (linked lists at each bucket)
Support put(key, value), get(key), remove(key), and contains(key) operations
Implement dynamic resizing when load factor exceeds 0.75
Rehash all existing entries when resizing occurs
Handle edge cases: null keys, duplicate keys, empty map operations
Provide size() and is_empty() utility methods
Write comprehensive unit tests covering all operations and edge cases
Document time and space complexity for each operation
Include a demo program showing practical usage examples

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: All operations work correctly, handles all edge cases, passes all tests

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Core operations work, minor edge case issues, most tests pass

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic functionality works, some edge cases fail, several test failures

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Significant bugs, many operations fail, limited test coverage

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Efficient algorithms, clean code structure, proper OOP design, optimal complexity

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Reasonable implementation, mostly efficient, minor design issues

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Works but inefficient in places, some design flaws

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Poor design choices, inefficient algorithms, hard to understand

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Comprehensive tests, edge cases covered, clear test organization

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good test coverage, most important cases tested

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic tests present, missing some important cases

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Minimal testing, major gaps in coverage

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Clear comments, complexity analysis, usage examples, design decisions explained

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good comments, complexity noted, basic documentation

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Some comments, minimal documentation

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Little to no documentation or comments

title: Data Structure Performance Analyzer
description: Build a comprehensive performance analysis tool that compares different data structures for common operations. Implement multiple data structures from scratch, measure their performance across various scenarios, and visualize the results. This project applies your knowledge of data structure trade-offs to real-world performance analysis.
requirements: Implement at least 4 data structures: dynamic array, linked list, binary search tree, and hash table
Create a benchmarking framework that measures time for insert, search, delete, and traversal operations
Test each data structure with varying input sizes (100, 1000, 10000, 100000 elements)
Test with different data patterns: random, sorted, reverse-sorted, and many duplicates
Generate performance comparison charts/graphs showing operation times vs input size
Calculate and display the observed time complexity (compare actual growth to theoretical)
Include memory usage measurements for each data structure
Write a report analyzing which data structure performs best for each scenario
Implement proper statistical analysis (multiple trials, average/median, standard deviation)
Create an interactive mode allowing users to run custom benchmarks

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: All 4+ data structures correctly implemented with optimal algorithms

levels.label: Good
levels.description: All data structures work correctly, minor efficiency issues

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Most structures work, some operations have bugs or inefficiencies

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Missing implementations or significant bugs in core operations

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Rigorous benchmarking with proper statistical analysis, handles edge cases

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Solid benchmarking, multiple trials, reasonable accuracy

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic timing works, limited statistical rigor

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Unreliable measurements, no statistical analysis

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Clear visualizations, insightful analysis, compares actual vs theoretical complexity

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Good charts, reasonable analysis, covers main points

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Basic visualization, limited analysis depth

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: No visualization or misleading/incorrect analysis

levels.label: Excellent
levels.description: Clean, modular code with comprehensive documentation and clear report

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Well-organized code, good documentation, solid report

levels.label: Satisfactory
levels.description: Code works but could be cleaner, basic documentation

levels.label: Needs Improvement
levels.description: Messy code, little documentation, incomplete report
